job description:
CAS uses intuitive technology, unparalleled scientific content and unmatched human expertise to help companies create groundbreaking innovations that benefit the world. As the scientific information solutions division of the American Chemical Society, CAS manages the largest curated reservoir of scientific knowledge, and for 111 years, has helped innovators mine, assess and apply that information to keep businesses thriving. The CAS team is global, diverse, endlessly curious and strives to make scientific insights accessible to innovators worldwide.

CAS is currently seeking a Data Scientist. This position will be located in our headquarters in Columbus, Ohio.

Qualifications:

Bachelor degree in Science, Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related field. Advanced degree is preferred. A degree in Science is preferred.

3+ years of experience performing statistical models, machine learning, and data analysis (prediction, classification, clustering, time series forecasting, regression models, etc.)

Excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate value and benefits to external customers and internal stakeholders.

Demonstrated ability to translate complicated models into actionable business insights.

Attention to detail, time management, strong multi-tasking and problem solving skills.

Proven ability to learn and expand in a fast-paced environment.

Two or more of the following technical requirements.

Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.

Experience working with and creating data architectures.

Knowledge of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and deep learning toolkits (CNTK, TensorFlow, etc.)

Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with their applications.

Experience visualizing and presenting data for stakeholders using Tableau, Periscope, Business Objects, D3, ggplot, etc.

Duties:

Work with internal functions including IT, marketing, sales, etc. to establish a content analytics and products & services development process.

Standardize a data analytics end-to-end process including methodology of business rules for content preparation with fast iterations, data integration of internal and external content, data cleansing and wrangling, data extraction/transformation/loading (ETL), data discovery of trends/patterns/relationships, data interpretation, hypothesis formulation and testing, and trends/relationship prediction.

Understand customer’s business problems and illustrate business insights to promote CAS brand and thought leadership in the market and develop products & services offering by extracting meaningful business insights and recommending critical business solutions to guide customers in making data driven business decisions.

Work with internal and external customers solving their business problems and deliver high quality products and services.

CAS offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package, including a generous vacation plan, medical, dental, vision insurance plans, and employee savings and retirement plans. Candidates for this position must be authorized to work in the United States and not require work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future. EEO/Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran

Job Location Columbus, Ohio, United States Position Type Full-Time/Regular
